question.text:
Match Column I with Column II.
 
  Column I   Column II
(1) Xenogamy (i) Transfer of pollen grain from the anther to the stigma of another flower of the same plant
(2) Autogamy (ii) Transfer of pollen grain from the anther to the stigma of the same flower
(3) Cleistogamy (iii) Transfer of pollen grain from the anther to the stigma of different plant
(4) Geitonogamy (iv) Flowers are invariably autogamous which do not open at all

<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text:
The different types of pollination taking place -

Xenogamy - pollen transfer to different flower of different plant

Autogamy - pollen transfer to same flower of same plant

Cleistogamy - Self pollination is maintained by keeping the flower closed.

Geitonogamy - Pollen transfer to different flower of same plant
